intro: Hymenopappus laxiflorus, commonly known as the slenderleaf sunhemp, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Hymenopappus laxiflorus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and dry grasslands.
